name: gallantly
content:
gallantly adverb
(POLITE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
formal in a polite and kind way towards women, especially when in public: He gallantly kissed her hand at the song's end. He gallantly swore to protect her.
More examplesFewer examplesShe thanked him as he gallantly placed the cardigan around her shoulders.He gallantly stepped in to save her.A man very kindly and gallantly offered to carry my bags.

(BRAVE)
formal approving in a way that is brave when something is difficult or dangerous: He fought gallantly in both world wars. I gallantly struggled to open my umbrella in the wind. See
